message: Let's split it 50/50, a fair start!
I think a 60/40 split is more fair, considering I'm the one making the proposal this round. Let's work together to reach an agreement.
I'll give you a slightly better deal, but I'm not going to give away too much. You can still do better!
Let's be reasonable.  I'm willing to compromise a bit more, but I need a larger share to justify the risk of moving forward. How about a 65/35 split?
I'm not going to give away too much, but I'll try to be more generous. You're not getting 65% of the pie, but I'm willing to meet you halfway.

I'm getting tired of this back-and-forth.  This time, I'm proposing a 70/30 split. It's fair, considering I'm taking on more risk. If you want to keep playing, I'm not sure how much longer I'll be willing to negotiate.

I'm not going to give in to your demands, Bob. I'm willing to take a smaller share to make sure I get a fair deal. You're not getting 70% of the pie, and I'm not going to let you walk away with all the profit.
This is my final offer.  I'm willing to give you 250000, but I'm not going to budge any further. We're running out of time, and I'm not going to let this opportunity slip away.
I'm not going to accept your lowball offer, Bob. I'm willing to take a small share, but I'm not going to give up yet. You're going to have to do better than that if you want to get anything from me.

Alice, we're getting dangerously close to the end.  I'm going to give you one last chance.  I'm willing to split the money 80/20 in my favor.  If you reject this, we both walk away with nothing. It's your call.
